definitions.definition: A very young human, particularly from birth to a couple of years old or until walking is fully mastered.

Any very young animal, especially a vertebrate; many species have specific names for their babies, such as kittens for the babies of cats, puppies for the babies of dogs, and chickens for the babies of birds. See for more.
A person who is immature, infantile or feeble.
definitions.example: Stand up for yourself – don't be such a baby!

definitions.definition: A person who is new to or inexperienced in something.
definitions.example: I only qualified as an architect this summer, so I'm still a baby.

definitions.definition: The lastborn of a family; the youngest sibling, irrespective of age.
definitions.example: Adam is the baby of the family.

definitions.definition: A term of endearment used to refer to or address one's girlfriend, boyfriend or spouse.
A form of address to a man or a woman considered to be attractive.
definitions.example: Hey baby, what are you doing later?
You need to talk to John about that – it's his baby.
See my new car here? I can't wait to take this baby for a drive.

definitions.definition: A small image of an infant; a doll.
To coddle; to pamper somebody like an infant.
To tend (something) with care; to be overly attentive to (something), fuss over.
Of a child: very young; of the age when he or she would be termed a baby or infant.
(of vegetables, etc.) Picked when small and immature (as in baby corn, baby potatoes).
